answers.answer: Hello,is this for yourself?You need to ask your Dr about referring you for diabetes education.  If you have knowledge then you may be more inclined to do what it takes.Also, if you cant get your blood sugars down you will face complications, and should consider starting insulin.However, no one can help you except yourself.  So you need to be proactive in taking charge of your own health.This is critical for both your quality and quantity of life.  Complications of uncontrolled diabetes are very unpleasant and will kill you eventually if the diabetes is not brought under control.

question: 63 years male, type 2 DM since 2003,HbAc1 9.7%Rx started 2013 Metformin 500mg 1x3 x monthHbAc1 7.8%Rx. Metformin 850mg 1x1 x monthHbAc1 8.4%Diet badExerciser very badPls help????
title: Uncontrolled Type 2 DM
